Reviews.Title: “good trip”
Reviews.Author: andypandy90
Reviews.Content: A great stay for 3 nights,very good breakfast with good choice,the room was very quiet and confortable bed.Very good location easy to find from the main Train station.within 200 m of the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chechus_2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, it was remodelated a few months ago, so everything looks pretty new, they have free internet connection which is great, even you can use 2 nice and new computers they have downstairs. Regarding its location is near the Sants Estacio, so from there is very easy to get to the airport and only costs 3,6 euros, of if you buy the T10 es even cheaper, less than 2 euros per ticket an you can use that to go to the airport, is easy to get to different places yuo also have the Metro nearby, but is not in the centre of the city, so if you stay there or you prepare yourself for a walk or you take the train or the metro. The staff were very friendly, it is not very cheap hotel normal rate is like 100 euros per night. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: GarryOwen78
Reviews.Content: The overall rating of this hotel is somewhat misleading - the old, negative reviews evidently refer to a very different hotel, before the change of management and renovation, and can safely be ignored. I would give top marks for value - 50 euros for a double, five minutes' walk from Sants Estacio (as long you take the right exit out the of the station). That's ideal for getting to the airport, and catching trains to France. Rooms are very modern, very clean, with all mod cons. But on the small side. On the downside - WiFi wasn't working during my stay there. But there are computers in the lobby, so that didn't cause too much inconvenience. The staff were OK - polite, reasonably friendly, reasonably helpful, nothing out of the ordinary. If you're looking for a late-night bite to eat near the hotel, you might come across a bar a couple of doors down in the direction of the station, called Xacobeo - avoid it like the plague. I ate meat there that turned out to be rotten, and was sick for three days. I would have reported them to the police but didn't have the time or energy. When I wanted to extend my stay, I found that the prices on Booking.com were significantly lower than the prices quoted at the reception. So that's worth bearing in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mikezman
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel 2 days in advance due to its availability via booking.com in spite of its below of average rating. So we arrived with no expectations but were pleasantly surprised by the hotel and the neighborhood. This is quite small 4 stars hotel located in quiet place in the center near the Sants Estacio metro station L3 - Green line, which we used daily to get to the major Barcelona's attractions. We did not buy the Barcelona tourist cards, instead we bought T10 ticket in the airport for about 8 euro for 10 rides and it was good for transfer from airport to hotel and for traveling by Barcelona's public transport. We did not take hotels breakfasts, instead we enjoyed the Carrefour supermarket which is just around the corner and is great! Every evening we surfed the web and decided for the next day route as well as spoke to children via Skype - the hotel provides free WiFi Internet access. We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights and payed 410 euro - quite good value for money. Overall, we are very happy with our Barcelona journey.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money”
Reviews.Author: derrickbAucklandNZ
Reviews.Content: EXpensive - pretentious and COLD. Hotel charge 15 Euro to park the car and 15 Euro for WiFi Access. Didnt bother to ask how much breakfast was - Im guessing 15 Euro! Room and bed was cold. TV only had Spanish channels. Carpet was disgusting, wallpaper ripped and the receptionists answer - complain to the manager, I only work here. What a wanker.Dont bother - I found a better hotel the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Cold and disorganised”
Reviews.Author: jammytart2k
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel following cancelled flight. Around 50 passengers arrived at the same time and check in was completely disorganised. The hotel had accepted the booking from the airline however was ill equiped to manage the number that arrived. check-in was a shambles with only one member of staff working to allocate rooms and copy passports etc. Restaurant apparently closed at 10.30pm however at 10.15 we were told that they were closed as it was 'quite late' and they "didnt have enough food anyway". The hotel then arrange to have take-away delivered which didnt arrive until almost midnight. No heating in rooms ment that I slept with the supplied bedding (cotton sheets with 1 light fleece blanket) but also had to add a second blanket I had packed to use during my flight. Only 1 mirror in the room which was in the bathroom made it very difficult for two people to get ready at the same time. Advice that was offered from reception regarding transfer time from the hotel to the bus station at rush hour was also less than useless, a supposed 20 minute journey took almost an hour. Overall I was pleased that I hadnt paid to stay at this hotel as I would have been looking for a refund.

Reviews.Title: “DON´T EVEN THINK ABOUT IT!”
Reviews.Author: MariaAndersson
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms. The rooms have not been renovated since it was built ... carpet was the most disgusting I have ever seen. Very nice staff, however, who complained and said that all rooms were in the same state. Poor breakfast with undrinkable coffee. Cheapest bread, cheese, ham etc.. Scrambled eggs made of mix. Internet 9 Euro / h! Four stars ... where they bought them?!

Reviews.Title: “Don't rely on a resevation, even when you booked and paid in advance”
Reviews.Author: EdHunt
Reviews.Content: I would never use this hotel or the group again. Having reserved and paid two weeks in advance, when arriving at 9 pm on the 31st December, wishing to spend New Years Eve in the center of Barcelona with our family, we were told the room had been double booked. We were not the only people, we found out there were another 4 couples Whose contract had not been honored. We were offered alternative accommodation at the airport but we had just arrived from the airport. Clearly if We wish to stay in the area of the airport that is where we would have stayed. We eventually occupied one single room. No apologies, no regrets and we only received the difference in price between double and single room after 2 months.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: helenfUk
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed at this hotel. We found the rooms clean and spacious. We had clean bedding and towels every day. The room was quiet at night, Some people might find the beds hard, I thought they were fine, may have been helped by the fact that after sight seeing all day and several Estrella and red wines in the evening I slept like a log. We didn't eat in the hotel. We had breakfast at a couple of the local cafes, Panet and Pan & co. We had an evening meal at Martelo close by. We also ate at Quince Nits and Rossinis just off Las Ramblas. The first restaurant was good value but you have to queue to get in. Rossinis was a lot more expensive but the food and the setting was excellent. We also found if you try and speak a few words in Spanish it was appriecated by the locals. We got the train from the airport to Barcelo Sants which took about 20 mins and was then a 10 min walk to the hotel. The Sants metro station was a few minutes walk. We used T10 cards which were about 7 euros and could be shared. It took about 10 mins to get to Las Ramblas We went to a match at The Nou Camp,which was about 10 mins on the metro. We bought the tickets on line before we left the UK We also used Bus Touristic which is a hop on hop off service taking in all the major sights.

Reviews.Title: “4 Days 3 Nights break in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: WalesSwanseajack
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, Rooms very clean, Maid service every day. Breakfast unbelievably poor. Tables not laid, had to ask for more food and utencils. Rest of the staff were excellent. Easy to get to Ramblas by Metro just around the corner. 15 Minute walk to Nou Camp to watch them play Would stay there again as the location was fine. Would probably look for breakfast outside the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you bring a torch and packed breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: cr4ckerman
Reviews.Content: Rooms so dark you needed a torch to see in the wardrobes. Desk staff friendly and helpful. Good location for Metro / station. Breakfast absolutely APPALING - hot stuff was cold; cold stuff ran out early; staff spent more time setting up for evening meal than sorting out breakfast issues!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: jennyw36
Reviews.Content: The hotel was too far out to be able to enjoy the evening atmosphere of barcelona. We did walk it a couple of times-but its not easy. The whole hotel stank of stale cigarette smoke, including our room, sheets and pillows! The wallpaper was peeling off the walls and the carpets were filthy. The shower did not work properly. The staff were sullen and did not speak. There was nothing hot left for breakfast when we went down. The tablecloths were dirty. The waiter actually closed the restaurant and left while we were still in there! It really spoiled the trip for us

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - terrible location - too far out”
Reviews.Author: gecko2
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at this hotel recently and even though the hotel is okay, the location is terrible. It is too far from the centre and many of the taxi drivers did not even know where it is. It's at least 30 minutes on the tram and then 30 minutes on the underground metro to the centre. A taxi should be about 15-17 Euros, but watch out for dodgy drivers who will try and say 20 Euros before they even set off. There's a supermarket 5 minutes walk up the hill which is good for most things. The pool and pool area is quite small and is quite hard to find as it was obviously an afterthought when they built the hotel, although it was always quiet when we were there. The rooms were okay, but could do with a good dusting in some of the corners. The staff are quite slow, and there's often no-one on the bar, so I would get some beers from the supermarket and keep in your room's fridge (which hardly works). I would not stay here again or recommend this to hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: shellbell_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and was really impressed. Room was nice and an adequate size for just myself onsidering I only slept there. Bathroom was really spacious and very clean. There was working air-con. Hardly heard any noise during the night. Room was cleaned every day with fresh towels. It was really close to the metro station too, literally a 2 minute walk, and Barcelona Sants train station is only 5 minutes away. I'd recommend getting the T-10 travelcard for getting around, it's really good value for money. Food-wise there was a nice bakery on the road across from the metro. Worth grabbing your breakfast there. And there was a nice restaurant called Casa Martelo a bit further down from the metro - very good value. And really watch out for pickpockets. I was in Park Guell walking under some trees and suddenly I had a bird poo on me, or so I thought. Had 2 very helpful ladies help me clean up but later on when I left the park I realised my money had been stolen. I figure while one of the girls was helping me get the muck off the other one went through my bag. Really be careful.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadsrl
Reviews.Content: If you read some of my other reviews, you will see I am not meticulous about hotels. When we are visiting a place, we are not using the room much anyway. However, this hotel was a real disappointment. Except for the price, very reasonable for Barcelona, and its proximity to Barcelona-Sants, the train station (as we were travelling through Spain via train) I have nothing good to say about it. The room looked depressing, dark in colours, with very little light, stained, and ruined wallpaper, various rust-stains in the bathroom, plus a strange humid smell when we got in. The breakfast was mediocre, compared with other 4* hotels we stayed in Spain. The selection seems to be the same everywhere (probably some Spanish standard), but somehow in this hotel it looked worse than in others. Speaking of 4*, I can’t see how this hotel is rated that high. As for its location (quite close to a prison btw, another depressing sight when passing by coming from one of the two subway stations serving the hotel), you pretty much depend on the subway to get to the main attractions. Connections are good and the trains run late in the night, therefore the location it not much of a problem for seeing the wonderful city of Barcelona. Except for the hotel, everything was perfect there, so if you cannot afford better hotels, you can take the risk with this one. Other reviewers seem to get better rooms then us, so maybe you will get lucky as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sangeetag
Reviews.Content: We arrived before our check-in time and our room was ready. We requested for a smoking room which was not done at the time of booking. The staff quickly gave us a smoking room. The staff was always cheerful and willing to help. There was a complementary newspaper every day. On the whole it was a good economical place to stay with a convenient metro station nearby and decent cafes close by. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hit & miss at City Park”
Reviews.Author: Hallix
Reviews.Content: Stayed in City Park for a couple of nights before joining a cruise. Reception and restaurant staff were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast OK - nothing special. Location is very close to Sants Metro Station - 15 minutes or so into central Barcelona. Had some difficulty one night getting back to hotel as taxi driver didn't know where it was but he dropped us off at the Metro station. Speaking to other guests, rooms are very variable in quality. Our room (515) was very small with double bed pushed into corner of room to create space to move around room - bathroom was almost as large! Window looking onto concrete wall. Wallpaper peeling off and carpets grubby. Other guests had larger rooms although those at front were woken by refuse collectors in middle of night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Most Suitable”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethCo_Antrim
Reviews.Content: Just home from a four day stay at this hotel. Had previously stayed nearer the centre of the city the last time in Barcelona and the noise made it impossible to sleep. This hotel might be a little further out but was much more convenient than I expected.A very quiet area but due to a new metro opening just less than 2 mins walk from the door and a 10-15mins journey on the green line and we were right on the Ramblas. This stop saved us from walking over to the main Sants Train station to get metro. We arrived at the train station coming in from the aeroport and took a taxi to our hotel which cost just over 8 euros for 2 but we later discovered it was only just over a 5 min walk if we had been sure of the directions. The hotel staff were excellent. Helpful and friendly which means a lot when it is hard to communicate as not many speak English. The rooms were very adequate although not many lights and the breakfast was excellent. Being in a quieter area not many resturants nearby but we found it no problem to take the metro into city centre when looking for more choice to eat. Resturant in hotel for evening 3 course meal looked really good but more than what we were looking for to eat.. I would recomment this hotel for freindly and helpful staff , quiet area and convenient to centre etc. We booked this hotel through hotelconnect and got a very good offer. Was a little bit worried about the hotel due to reviews on other web sites but these proved not to be a problem for us. Elizabeth, Co.Antrim

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly Service, Close to Metro and Trains.”
Reviews.Author: MartinR_8
Reviews.Content: I've just returned home from a 7 nights stay at the City Park Hotel in Barcelona and absolutely loved it. The staff was very helpful and were always in a good mood. The lady at reception provided me with a few guides to Barcelona which proved to be very useful for my visit. The hotel is very clean and quiet, so I had no problem falling asleep after a day of sightseeing. The breakfast is fresh and there is so much variety that I think it caters for most tastes. The room was clean and the bed was firm, but very comfortable. The only thing about it that I didn't like was the smell of cigarette smoke on the fifth floor, where my room was. It seems to be ingrained in the curtains and carpets. The Hotel is situated just around the corner from the Sants metro station which will take you straight into the centre of town (Placa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas). It is also about 5 mins walk from the Sants Estacio train station, where you can get on a train to Sitges, or Madrid or to the neighbouring countries. I would definitley go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maximus80
Reviews.Content: The City Park is just a great hotel. Very nice, clean and spacious room, great bath, great breakfast. The location is also great: near the Sants Stació station, and can get the subway and also trains to Madrid from there. Is stays just about a two blocks walking distance from the hotel. The staff was very kind and the price was very reasonable. Great choice at all.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: garfieldBelfast
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel having had my purse stolen on stepping off the airport bus in Playa Catalunya - beware of theft it is rife in Barcelona. Several people on the same flight lost purses and handbags in the City. The guy on the reception desk named Gandi couldnt have done enough for me and helped me cancel my credit card instantly. The staff were very helpful, the room was nicely decorated and the bathroom was luxurious. There was just about everything provided in the bathroom that you could think of - bath gel, shampoo, toothbrushes and toothpaste, razor, tissues, combs, shoe shine kit .... I had read another review so knew there was no tea/coffee making facilities so I packed the travel kettle - no hastle. There is a supermarket just around the corner from the hotel.The free soft drink mini bar is just on day of arrival - 3 small bottles of pop. Handy to keep drinks cool though. The metro is approx 3 mins stroll from the hotel and the Sants station 5 mins stroll. The bus touristic can be found at the bus station right beside Sants so everything is really handy. 30 min train journey to Sitges - highly recommended and the train is free! Taxi back to the airport costs 28 euros. Jan Belfast

Reviews.Title: “Whats the fuss”
Reviews.Author: nickjs
Reviews.Content: I got to say after reading reviews on this hotel I was somewhat apprehensive,alas without just cause.Arrived with my wife to find a very modern and clean hotel,and was efficiently checked in by staff. Room was clean and tidy and had all you would need with exception of tea/coffee machine ,but a free soft drinks mini bar instead so no prob there.Breakfast was a good mixture of toasts,rolls,cereals,fruits,and small hot selection.Plenty of fruits juices and hot drinks.Staff were pleasant and helpful. For those who complained of the location being over 30 min from centre must of got lost.Metro is 2 min at most from hotel and takes 12 min to Ramblas.get Metro to Drassanes for best location for places of interest.This is a centre position for the modern Port Vell area and La Rambla the other way.If to come to Barcelona again I will stick with what I know and book the City park again

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Medium City
HotelInfo.Address: Nicaragua 47, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
